item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Jorge Luis Borges
item.description: "I have always imagined that Paradise will be a kind of library." -- Jorge Luis Borges

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Cicero
item.description: "If you have a garden and a library, you have everything you need." -- Cicero

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Lemony Snicket
item.description: "A good library will never be too neat, or too dusty, because somebody will always be in it, taking books off the shelves and staying up late reading them." -- Lemony Snicket

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Maya Angelou
item.description: "Any book that helps a child to form a habit of reading, to make reading one of his deep and continuing needs, is good for him." -- Maya Angelou

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Gail Carson Levine
item.description: "A library is infinity under a roof." -- Gail Carson Levine

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Joan Bauer
item.description: "My grandma always said that God made libraries so that people didn't have any excuse to be stupid." -- Joan Bauer

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description: "A room without books is like a body without a soul." -- Marcus Tullius Cicero

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Library Avengers
item.description: "People become librarians because they know too much. Their knowledge extends beyond mere categories. They cannot be confined to disciplines. Librarians are all-knowing and all-seeing. They bring order to chaos. They bring wisdom and culture to the masses. They preserve every aspect of human knowledge. Librarians rule. And they will kick the crap out of anyone who says otherwise. --libraryavengers.org" -- Library Avengers

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "Read. Read anything. Read the things they say are good for you, and the things they claim are junk. You'll find what you need to find. Just read." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by John Boyne
item.description: "There were others, such as Jack London,who offered their readers such a respite from the miserable horror of existence that their books were like gifts from the gods. (Character of Tristan Sadler in "the Absolutist")" -- John Boyne

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Louise Penny
item.description: "Few things are better in the world than a room full of librarians. I consider them literary heroes. The keepers and defenders of the written word." -- Louise Penny

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Jacqueline Kennedy Onassis
item.description: "There are many little ways to enlarge your child's world. Love of books is the best of all." -- Jacqueline Kennedy Onassis

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Adam Stanley
item.description: "Every book you read may not save your life but some of them will." -- Adam Stanley

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by don Miguel Ruiz
item.description: "The Four Agreements 1. Be impeccable with your word. 2. Don’t take anything personally. 3. Don’t make assumptions. 4. Always do your best. " -- don Miguel Ruiz

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Mary Oliver
item.description: "Instructions for living a life. Pay attention. Be astonished. Tell about it." -- Mary Oliver

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Ivan Doig
item.description: "I thought again what an achievement a book is, a magic box simultaneously holding the presence of the author and the wonders of the world." -- Ivan Doig

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Madeleine L'Engle
item.description: "You have to write the book that wants to be written. And if the book will be too difficult for grown-ups, then you write it for children." -- Madeleine L'Engle

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Harley King
item.description: "Story is a butterfly whose wings transport us to another world where we receive gifts that change who we are and who we want to be." -- Harley King

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Markus Zusak
item.description: "Sometimes people are beautiful. Not in looks. Not in what they say. Just in what they are." -- Markus Zusak

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Markus Zusak
item.description: "Maybe everyone can live beyond what they're capable of." -- Markus Zusak

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Markus Zusak
item.description: "Sometimes you read a book so special that you want to carry it around with you for months after you've finished just to stay near it." -- Markus Zusak

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Markus Zusak
item.description: "It's not a big thing, but I guess it's true--big things are often just small things that are noticed." -- Markus Zusak

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Markus Zusak
item.description: "I'm not the messenger at all. I'm the message. " -- Markus Zusak

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Markus Zusak
item.description: "I'd rather chase the sun than wait for it." -- Markus Zusak

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Markus Zusak
item.description: "I think she ate a salad and some soup. And loneliness. She ate that, too. " -- Markus Zusak

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Markus Zusak
item.description: "My arms are killing me. I didn't know words could be so heavy." -- Markus Zusak

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Markus Zusak
item.description: "Only in today's sick society can a man be persecuted for reading too many books." -- Markus Zusak

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Markus Zusak
item.description: "If a guy like you can stand up and do what you did, then maybe everyone can. Maybe everyone can live beyond what they're capable of. " -- Markus Zusak

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Markus Zusak
item.description: "Of course you're real-like any thought or any story. It's real when you're in it." -- Markus Zusak

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Markus Zusak
item.description: "We both laugh and run and the moment is so thick around me that i feel like dropping into it to let it carry me." -- Markus Zusak
